page.title: 15ECOLOGY
page.content: Renfrew is now a comletely smokeless zone. The last 3 winters have been completely fog free as a result. Noise pollution is however a problem because the town is close to Glasgow Airport. The Local Authority provides grants for double glazing to affected households. The level of noise is monitored by Local Environment Inspectors. Another hazard is the risk of importing foreign diseases to the area. Hnece 24-hour emergency service is operated to disinfect aircraft. A vast programme of landscaping derelict sites is underway, involving shrub and tree planting and the provision of grass and all-weather pitches. It is mainly financed by central and local government through schemes for unmployed school leavers.The area has four tree preservation orders in force.
